alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 4:49PM CDT until August 08 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Pulaski County in central Missouri... * Until 1100 PM CDT Monday. * At 449 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Waynesville. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly along the creek within Bradford Hollow that runs near Waynesville High School. A section of Southside Road could become impassable soon due to flash flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northern Fort Leonard Wood, Waynesville and St. Robert. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
